body_content.explanation: If the weather brightens, it becomes lighter and less cloudy, with more sun:
examples: The day will start cloudy but brighten later.
It was rainy this morning, but it brightened up (= the sun started shining) after lunch.

body_content.explanation: to make a place lighter or more colourful:
examples: The room was small and dark, without so much as a ray of light to brighten the gloom.
I used a large red rug to brighten up my living room.

body_content.explanation: to seem happy or happier, or more full of hope than before:
examples: Her eyes brightened when she saw him enter the room.
Alex brightened up when he heard the word "dinner".

body_content.explanation: to make someone feel or make a situation seem happier or more full of hope:
examples: There are, however, one or two items of good news to brighten the economic picture a bit.
Seeing her always brightens up my day.
I hoped these flowers might brighten you up.
